item.title: How to Read and Write Greek Characters and Their Meaning in Mathematics and Science
item.description: Alpha $\Alpha, \alpha$ Alpha is read as “alpha”. The TeX codes are \Alpha, \alpha respectively. It is the first letter of the Greek alphabet, and the phrase “alpha and omega” means “the beginning and the end.” Index of an index set $\alpha$ In differential geometry, a curve $\alpha$ Curve used to define tangent vectors on a differential manifold $\alpha$ Beta $\Beta, \beta$ Beta is read as “beta”. The TeX codes
